intro: Wahlenbergia subtilis, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, linear leaves and has a compact, low-growing habit. Wahlenbergia subtilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
